definition: to rent/to charter/to rent land or a house for subletting/fixed rent for farmland
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax

sentences.english: Adrian:Check anyway. I prefer charter flights to commercial ones.
sentences.chinese: 好好查查吧，比起商务舱，我还是偏好包租的座位。

sentences.english: The major multi-car pileup was caused by a charter bus.
sentences.chinese: 这起严重连环车祸是由一辆包租的大客车引起的。

sentences.english: We plan to charter a special train for London.
sentences.chinese: 我们计画包租一列往伦敦的特别火车。

sentences.english: You can also take a bareboat from Cairns to the outer Greater Barrier Reef.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以从凯恩斯包租空船，自己驶往大堡礁的外礁。

sentences.english: The club chartered two buses to take us on holiday to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部包租了两辆公共汽车送我们去巴黎度假。

definition: (of a landlord) to rent out one or more parts of a property/(of a tenant) to sublet one or more parts of a property/(agriculture) sharecropping
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
(of a house or room) to be for rent
borrower/leaser/the hiring side of a contract
to lease/to hire/to rent (sth from sb)
